question.text: Some people think a job not only provides income but also a social life. Others think it is better to develop a social life with people you do not work with. Discuss both views and give your opinion.

questionType.explanation: You must discuss BOTH perspectives equally (workplace socializing AND non-work social life) and clearly state your own opinion.

Discuss benefits of having social life outside work
Provide specific examples for each view

steps.title: Build Paragraphs
steps.completionCriteria: Complete all 4 paragraphs (10+ words per blank)

content.instructions: Fill in each blank to build your essay paragraph by paragraph. Aim for 10-15 words per blank.

paragraphs.name: Introduction
paragraphs.template: While some _____ [state the first view about workplace social life], others _____ [state the opposite view about non-work social life]. In my opinion, _____ [clearly state YOUR position].

blanks.label: First view about workplace social life
blanks.hint: Start with 'believe that jobs' or 'argue that workplaces'
blanks.placeholder: e.g., believe that jobs provide valuable social opportunities through daily interaction with colleagues

blanks.label: Opposite view about non-work social life
blanks.hint: Use 'argue that' or 'contend that' followed by benefits of separate social life
blanks.placeholder: e.g., contend that developing friendships outside the workplace leads to more authentic and balanced relationships

blanks.label: Your position
blanks.hint: Be clear! Take a position or say 'it depends on...'
blanks.placeholder: e.g., maintaining a balanced social life that includes both workplace friendships and outside connections is most beneficial

paragraphs.name: Body Paragraph 1
paragraphs.template: On the one hand, _____ [topic sentence about workplace social life advantages]. This is because _____ [explain the reason]. For instance, _____ [give a specific example]. As a result, _____ [state the consequence or benefit].

blanks.label: Topic sentence - workplace social life advantages
blanks.hint: Main benefit of developing social life through work
blanks.placeholder: e.g., workplace environments naturally foster social connections through daily collaboration and shared professional goals

blanks.label: Explain the reason
blanks.hint: WHY does workplace provide good social opportunities?
blanks.placeholder: e.g., colleagues spend significant time together working towards common objectives, which creates natural bonding opportunities

blanks.label: Specific example
blanks.placeholder: e.g., employees who collaborate on challenging projects often develop strong camaraderie and continue socializing through after-work activities

blanks.label: Consequence/benefit
blanks.hint: What is the final outcome of this benefit?
blanks.placeholder: e.g., these office friendships can make work more enjoyable and create a supportive professional network

paragraphs.name: Body Paragraph 2
paragraphs.template: On the other hand, _____ [topic sentence about non-work social life advantages]. The main reason is _____ [explain why]. For example, _____ [specific example]. Therefore, _____ [conclusion about this perspective].

blanks.label: Topic sentence - non-work social life advantages
blanks.hint: Main benefit of socializing outside work
blanks.placeholder: e.g., building friendships outside the workplace offers greater authenticity and freedom from professional constraints

blanks.label: Explain why
blanks.hint: Explain the mechanism or reasoning behind this benefit
blanks.placeholder: e.g., relationships formed through shared personal interests are based on genuine compatibility rather than professional obligations

blanks.label: Specific example
blanks.hint: Concrete example showing non-work social life benefits
blanks.placeholder: e.g., people who join hobby groups or sports clubs meet diverse individuals from different backgrounds and professions

blanks.label: Conclusion about this view
blanks.placeholder: e.g., this diversity enriches social perspectives and provides healthy separation between work and personal life

paragraphs.name: Conclusion
paragraphs.template: In conclusion, while _____ [briefly summarize both views], I believe _____ [restate your opinion with a final thought].

blanks.label: Summarize both views
blanks.hint: One sentence mentioning both workplace and non-work social life advantages
blanks.placeholder: e.g., both workplace friendships and outside social connections offer distinct benefits in terms of convenience and authenticity

blanks.label: Restate opinion + final thought
blanks.hint: Clearly restate YOUR position and add a final insight
blanks.placeholder: e.g., maintaining diverse social networks from both spheres creates the most balanced and fulfilling social life while supporting work-life balance

modelEssay.text:
The relationship between employment and social connections has become an increasingly debated topic in modern society. While some believe that jobs provide valuable social opportunities through daily workplace interaction, others contend that developing friendships outside professional settings leads to more authentic relationships. In my opinion, maintaining a balanced social life that includes both workplace friendships and outside connections is most beneficial for overall wellbeing.

On the one hand, workplace environments naturally foster meaningful social connections through collaboration and shared goals. Colleagues spend substantial time together working towards common objectives, which creates natural opportunities for bonding and camaraderie. For instance, employees who collaborate on challenging projects often develop strong workplace friendships that extend beyond office hours through after-work socializing and team activities. Furthermore, these professional relationships can provide valuable emotional support during stressful work periods. As a result, office friendships not only make daily work more enjoyable but also create supportive professional networks that benefit career development.

On the other hand, building friendships outside the workplace offers greater authenticity and freedom from professional constraints. The main reason is that relationships formed through shared personal interests are based on genuine compatibility rather than professional obligations or workplace hierarchies. For example, people who join hobby groups, sports clubs, or community organizations meet diverse individuals from different backgrounds and professions who share similar passions. This diversity enriches social perspectives and ensures healthy boundaries between work and personal life, reducing the risk of burnout.

In conclusion, while both workplace friendships and outside social connections offer distinct advantages, combining them provides the greatest benefits. Workplace relationships offer convenience and professional support, while outside friendships provide authenticity and diverse perspectives. I believe maintaining diverse social networks from both spheres creates the most balanced and fulfilling social life while supporting healthy work-life balance.
